isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 5000 9100 9200 9400 9900 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - 5000, 5000i, 9000, 9000i - OPERATION - SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER MODULE

svcprocinfo.para: The Speedometer/Tachometer module is connected to the vehicle electrical system and gauge clusters through two 20-way connectors (421) and (422).

svcsubproc.title: Battery Feed
svcsubproc.para: The module receives battery power (key ON or OFF) from 15A fuse F5-C at connector (421) circuit 14G. The battery power circuit is necessary only for those vehicles equipped with the digital odometer/hourmeter function.

svcsubproc.title: Ignition Feed
svcsubproc.para: The module receives ignition power (key ON) from 10A fuse F4-A. This powers the module.

svcsubproc.title: Module Ground
svcsubproc.para: The Speedometer/Tachometer module is grounded through connector (421) circuit 11-GL through the cab harness to the ground stud on the left dash panel.

svcsubproc.title: Internal Alarm
svcsubproc.para: The Speedometer/Tachometer module alarm is bolted to the bottom of the module and a short lead plugs into the module body. The alarm is replaceable as an individual item.
